name: Mafia / Werewolf (classic)
brief_descriptions: Moderator-led hidden-role game: villagers vs mafia/werewolves, night/day cycles and many role variants; classic large-group social deduction.

name: Ultimate Werewolf
brief_descriptions: Expanded Werewolf system with many roles and scenarios for very large groups; requires a moderator for large-party play.

name: One Night Ultimate Werewolf
brief_descriptions: App-assisted single-night Werewolf variant with no elimination; quick rounds and high replayability for parties.

name: Blood on the Clocktower
brief_descriptions: Storyteller-driven hidden-role game where eliminated players remain engaged; rich asymmetric roles and deep social interaction.

name: Two Rooms and a Boom
brief_descriptions: Large-group social deduction played across two rooms; rounds involve negotiation and player exchanges for party-scale drama.

name: The Resistance / Avalon
brief_descriptions: Mission-based hidden-role deduction: loyal members try missions while hidden spies sabotage; Avalon adds Arthurian asymmetric roles.

name: Secret Hitler
brief_descriptions: Political hidden-role game (Liberals vs Fascists) with asymmetric powers; deduction centers on policy enactment and identity exposure.

name: Spyfall
brief_descriptions: Bluffing Q&A game where one spy deduces a shared location while others use questions to detect the imposter.

name: The Chameleon
brief_descriptions: Quick party game: one player lacks the secret word and must blend in while others identify the odd-one-out.

name: Deception: Murder in Hong Kong
brief_descriptions: Forensic-clue deduction: a silent forensic scientist gives nonverbal clues to help identify the murderer among players.

name: Decrypto
brief_descriptions: Team-based code-clue deduction where teams transmit hints while preventing the opposing team from intercepting them.

name: Coup
brief_descriptions: Bluffing and elimination card game where players claim roles and challenge actions to eliminate opponents.

name: Among Us (Innersloth)
brief_descriptions: Online real-time impostor game: crewmates do tasks while impostors sabotage and kill; meetings enable discussion and voting.

name: Town of Salem
brief_descriptions: Role-heavy online Mafia-style game with many roles and complex night/day interactions driving deception and deduction.

name: Project Winter
brief_descriptions: Survival-focused social deduction: traitors sabotage cooperative objectives while environmental threats and distrust complicate escape.

name: Deceit / Deceit 2
brief_descriptions: Horror FPS social deduction where infected players secretly eliminate innocents while completing objectives; action-oriented deception.

name: Goose Goose Duck
brief_descriptions: Among Us–style online impostor game with many roles, proximity chat, and larger lobbies for varied social-deduction modes.

name: Betrayal.io
brief_descriptions: Browser-based impostor-style game offering quick matches with role abilities and automated night/day cycles.

name: SpyParty
brief_descriptions: High-skill asymmetric espionage duel: one player blends among NPCs while the other must detect suspicious, goal-directed behavior.

name: Unfortunate Spacemen
brief_descriptions: Space-themed social deduction with shapeshifters/traitors and objective-based escape; mixes action with paranoia and deduction.

name: Triple Agent!
brief_descriptions: Phone/tablet-driven party social deduction with hidden loyalties and short, fast rounds emphasizing quick deception.

name: Mafia Blitz
brief_descriptions: Fast bluffing social deduction with role-drafting and single-round play that minimizes elimination and speeds sessions.

name: Wolvesville / Werewolf Online
brief_descriptions: Mobile/online adaptations of Werewolf/Mafia offering automated moderation, matchmaking, and casual social-deduction play.
